title: Part B Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Loop accesses all necessary parts of message string (no bounds error)

Canonical Solution:

public String shortenMessage(String message, String str)
{
   String result = message;
   while (result.indexOf(str) >= 0)
   {
      int idx = result.indexOf(str);
      result = result.substring(0, idx) + 
               result.substring(idx + str.length());
   }    
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • use either a condition or an update that would cause an infinite loop or skipped elements in some cases

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • use either a condition or an update that would cause an infinite loop or skipped elements in some cases

title: Part B Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Identifies a location of str within message if there is one (and all String method calls are syntactically valid)

Canonical Solution: 

public String shortenMessage(String message, String str)
{
   String result = message;
   while (result.indexOf(str) >= 0)
   {
      int idx = result.indexOf(str);
      result = result.substring(0, idx) + 
               result.substring(idx + str.length());
   }    
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to use the identified location

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to use the identified location

title: Part B Point 3
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Builds and returns the correct string derived from first parameter with substring removed as many times as necessary (algorithm)

Canonical Solution:

public String shortenMessage(String message, String str)
{
   String result = message;
   while (result.indexOf(str) >= 0)
   {
      int idx = result.indexOf(str);
      result = result.substring(0, idx) + 
               result.substring(idx + str.length());
   }    
   return result;
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to return the string
  • print the string instead of or in addition to returning it

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to return the string
  • print the string instead of or in addition to returning it
